meanings.definition: A support or framework used in mining.
meanings.sent1: The miners relied on the sturdy stull to keep the tunnel from collapsing.
meanings.sent2: The wooden stull provided much-needed reinforcement in the mine shaft.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the stull was a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: The stull stood tall like a guardian, protecting the miners below.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow stull contrasted against the dark mine walls, making it easy to spot.

meanings.sent1: She had to stull the suitcase with all her clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to stull the boxes carefully to fit them all in the truck.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to stull as many toys as possible into the small box.
meanings.sent4: He managed to stull his backpack with snacks for the long hike.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to stull the ingredients into the pot to make a delicious stew.

meanings.definition: A mixture of waste rock and ore used in mining.
meanings.sent1: The miners separated the valuable ore from the stull to extract minerals.
meanings.sent2: The stull was carefully processed to recover any remaining minerals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the shiny stull for precious gems.
meanings.sent4: The stull resembled a colorful mosaic of rocks and minerals.
meanings.sent5: The miners sifted through the stull to find hidden treasures.
